section.title: Introduction
section.para: This article describes the communication protocol used to for communications between the host (PC) and the device (MCU).

section.title: Requirements
section.para: We need to send data to the device. This data will be HPGL or G-code. Besides that, it would be nice to have low level control of the device from the host, so we need to select between two different types of transmitted data.
It would be nice to have checksum validation. Only one connection/session is required.

section.title: SNAP (Scalable Node Address Protocol)
section.para: This protocol may be used. It features error correction with checksum and ACK/NAK signals.

We want to be able to send two different kinds of data, but SNAP does not support this. It could be implemented by using one of the 128 available command codes to select stream. Then SNAP becomes a multistream protocol, and we just use two streams.
